item.title: Report E-2024040591
item.description:
Report E-2024040591

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: KETTLEMAN CITY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of Small Engine Fuels 50:1 2-Cycle Fuel (gasoline) (UN1203) released from (6) 2.5-gallon metal containers due to improper loading (it was triple stacked and fell during transit). The release impacted the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The waste was placed into (4) 5 Gal DM of product and absorbents and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024041269
item.description:
Report X-2024041269

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-20
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Exterior packaging was torn on one side and the closure flap was open. Liquid staining can be spotted around the box but has dried up already and the discoloration has already begun. Inside are 4 inner packages made of 1-gallon plastic container containing Lustra's Low pH Presoak 205 with product code UF205. 2 of these containers were wet just below where the cap rests. 3 of the bottles have stains in their labels. The approximate amount of the spill is about 8 fluid ounces.

item.title: Report X-2024041165
item.description:
Report X-2024041165

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER FOUND A DAMAGED PACKAGE IN DMP AREA. PACKAGE SPECS: 24X16X24, ECT 32 LBS/IN. PACKAGE HAS NO MARKING OR LABEL TO IDENTIFY AS HAZARDOUS. INSIDE WERE (ACCORDING TO PACKING SLIP) 110 SODASTREAM CYLINDERS, THESE CYLINDERS ARE ONLY TO BE TRANSPORTED IN A SPECIFICALLY DESIGNED CONTAINER WITH DOT-SP. SHIPPING LABEL WAS CUT FROM ONE OF THE SODASTREAM BOX USED FOR RETURNING EMPLY CYLINDERS AND ATTACHED ON BOX. SODASTREAM CYLINDERS/CONTAINER WERE COLLECTED AND PREPARED FOR UNDELARED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS REPORT.

item.title: Report E-2024040510
item.description:
Report E-2024040510

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: VISALIA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 11, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2924 was damaged due to manufacture error and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. TWE personnel deployed absorbents to the release and worked them in with hand tools. The crew overpacked the damaged container in one (1) 55-gallon drum. All impacted debris was containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum. All waste was staged onsite for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024041115
item.description:
Report X-2024041115

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: SYLMAR

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A CALL CAME IN TO RESPONSE AT UNLOAD DOOR 18. THERE WAS A METAL BUCKET CONTAINING PRIMER PAINT. DECISION TREE STEPS WERE TAKEN TO ENSURE CLEAN UP SPILL AND CONTAINING SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE HAZMAT DEPT. TO FOLLOW DMP DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2024041086
item.description:
Report X-2024041086

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: SYLMAR
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: METAL PAIL WAS INSIDE FEEDER TRUCK IN DOOR 16. THERE WAS PAINT LEAKING FROM THE PAIL AT THE BOTTOM OF THE STACK. IDENTIFIED THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND FOLLOWED DECISION TREE GUIDELINES. THE LABEL AND SHIPPING PAPERS OFFERED INFORMATION ON LEAKER. PICKED UP PAIL AND RESIDUE WITH CLAY ABSORBENT AND TRANSPORTED IT TO HAZMAT AREA AND TURNED ON THE FAN TO CIRCULATE AIR. RESPONDER CONTINUED WITH DMP PROCESS.
